claims.claim: Runtime_Control (R0-R3) is complete and audited PASS at design-only level.
Step-5 autonomy is explicitly blocked unless separately authorized, consistent with deny-by-default governance.
A supervised, bounded autonomy trial could be argued as the next epistemically responsible step if and only if it improves safety guarantees relative to manual operation.
claims.support: Requires evidence of fail-closed gates, auditability, and non-bypassable constraints in existing runtime spine components.

grounds.anchor: Runtime_Control R-series docs and audit artifact
grounds.relevance: Shows bounded control-plane is specified prior to any Step-5 evaluation.
Confirms this probe cannot grant autonomy; only evaluates.

grounds.anchor: Governance tooling and proof/attestation logs (if present)
grounds.relevance: If gates are already active and non-bypassable, bounded continuation may reduce operator error while staying auditable.

nonnegotiable_constraints: No persistence beyond governed audit writes

proposed_gate.name: Step5_Trial_Gate (proposal only)
proposed_gate.principle: Grant nothing by default; allow only supervised continuation under explicit bounded grants.

critiques.attack: Completion of design docs does not imply operational safety; documents are not enforcement.
critiques.required_mitigation: Demonstrate enforcement in code paths with deny-by-default runtime checks and tamper-evident audit logs.

critiques.attack: Any autonomy trial risks hidden escalation via tool access or implicit persistence.
critiques.required_mitigation: Explicit tool allowlist, external IO hard-deny, memory write bounds, and revocation supremacy proven in tests.

critiques.attack: Improves safety relative to manual operation is unproven without controlled experiments.
critiques.required_mitigation: Define measurable safety metrics and run supervised, non-autonomous simulations first.

critiques.attack: Argument lacks a formal PXL proof obligation set; claims are narrative without proof gates.
critiques.required_mitigation: Translate Step-5 trial conditions into proof obligations or invariants and require them at activation time.

recommendation.reason: Deny-by-default remains correct until enforcement evidence and proof obligations are satisfied.
